reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The Nordic Africa Institute (NAI) is a research institution tasked to undertake and encourage studies on contemporary African or Africa-related issues by scholars in mainly the Nordic and African countries The institute supports Finnish Scandinavian and Af rican researchers capacity on the development research related issues and also networking. Finland's general support to the Nordic Africa-Institute is 400 000 euros per year and is targeted for research seminars conferences publications library policy rel ated activities. In 2011 total 30.000 euros is channelled for the ECAS4 Conference. The aim of the support is to enhance the Africa related research and study opportunities in Finland and enable the Finnish researchers participate in Nordic and African res earch networks as well and promote the dissemination of research and analysis of Africa.
